intro: Parosela megacarpa, commonly known as the giant-seeded parosela, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its fruit is a distinctive capsule that contains numerous seeds, some of which are notably large. Parosela megacarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and riverbanks.
